intro: Munnozia nivea, commonly known as the white munnozia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub environments. Munnozia nivea is known for its low-growing habit and is adapted to withstand drought and poor soil conditions.
